conclusion: Analyze the processes involved in the cycle A→B→C→A.
A→B is an isochoric process with volume at 2 L.
B→C is an isobaric process with pressure decreasing from 4×10⁵ Pa to 1×10⁵ Pa.
C→A is an isochoric process with volume at 5 L.
Use the ideal gas law PV = nRT.
At state A: P_A = 1×10⁵ Pa, V_A = 2 L, T_A = 200 K.
At state B: P_B = 4×10⁵ Pa, V_B = 2 L.
Use relation P_A/T_A = P_B/T_B to solve for T_B.
Calculate T_B = 200 K × (4×10⁵ Pa / 1×10⁵ Pa) = 800 K.
The temperature of the gas at state B is 800 K.
